svg.text: • Synchronous training with identical model copies on each GPU
• All-reduce communication for gradient aggregation and weight updates
• Optimized for large-scale training with specialized matrix operations
• Automatic sharding across TPU cores with XLA compilation
• Scale across multiple machines with fault tolerance and collective communication
• Requires cluster setup with TF_CONFIG environment variable for coordination
• Asynchronous parameter updates with dedicated parameter servers
• Suitable for large-scale training with variable network latency
• Better fault tolerance but potential staleness in gradients
• Start with MirroredStrategy for single-machine multi-GPU setups (easiest to implement)
• Use TPUStrategy for large models requiring massive compute (research/production scale)
• Consider MultiWorkerMirroredStrategy when you need to scale beyond single machine limitations
